unnormalised: I keep seeing questions about all the different government IDs in India. It can be quite confusing, esp. for newcomers! So, let's try to clear up some of the basics about Indian government-issued IDs.
normalised: I keep seeing questions about all the different government I-Ds in India. It can be quite confusing, especially for newcomers! So, let's try to clear up some of the basics about Indian government-issued I-Ds.

unnormalised: First off, the most important one these days is the Aadhaar card. It's a 12-digit unique identification number issued by UIDAI. Think of it as your basic ID for everything from opening a bank account to getting a SIM card. Your Aadhaar No. will be required for lots of things, so keep it safe! It is technically not proof of citizenship, though.
normalised: First off, the most important one these days is the Aadhaar card. It's a twelve-digit unique identification number issued by U-I-D-A-I. Think of it as your basic I-D for everything from opening a bank account to getting a S-I-M card. Your Aadhaar number will be required for lots of things, so keep it safe! It is technically not proof of citizenship, though.

unnormalised: Then there's the PAN card, which is crucial for financial transactions and taxes. PAN stands for Permanent Account Number, and itâ€™s a 10-character alphanumeric identifier issued by the Income Tax Department. You'll need this for filing your income tax returns, investing in stocks, or any significant financial dealings. Remember to always provide your PAN no. for any transaction above Rs. 50,000.
normalised: Then there's the P-A-N card, which is crucial for financial transactions and taxes. P-A-N stands for Permanent Account Number, and it's a ten-character alphanumeric identifier issued by the Income Tax Department. You'll need this for filing your income tax returns, investing in stocks, or any significant financial dealings. Remember to always provide your P-A-N number for any transaction above rupee fifty thousand.

unnormalised: Next, we have the Voter ID card, officially known as the Electoral Photo Identity Card (EPIC). This is your primary ID for voting in elections. Your Voter ID is an essential document for exercising your right to vote. You can usually find your EPIC number on the front of the card. Don't forget to update it if you move!
normalised: Next, we have the Voter I-D card, officially known as the Electoral Photo Identity Card (E-P-I-C). This is your primary I-D for voting in elections. Your Voter I-D is an essential document for exercising your right to vote. You can usually find your E-P-I-C number on the front of the card. Don't forget to update it if you move!

unnormalised: Finally, there's the driving license. This serves as proof that you're authorized to drive a vehicle in India. You'll need it to drive any motor vehicle legally. The driving license number is unique to each individual and is usually printed on the front of the license. For example DL-1234567890123. Remember to carry your DL when driving!

unnormalised: These are the core government IDs. There are of course others like the passport (for international travel), but understanding these main IDs will make your life much easier in India.
